biography.value:
Skull lords have claimed vast regions of the Shadowfell as their dominion. From these blighted lands, they wage war against their rivals, commanding hordes of the undying in a bid to establish dominance. Yet skull lords always prove to be their own worst enemies; each is a combined being born from three hateful individuals, and they constantly plot against themselves.

Infighting and treachery brought skull lords into existence. The first of them appeared in the aftermath of Vecna’s bid to conquer the world of Greyhawk, after the vampire Kas betrayed Vecna and took his eye and hand. In the confusion resulting from this turn of events, Vecna’s warlords turned against each other, and his plans were dashed. In a rage, Vecna gathered up his generals and captains and bound them in groups of three, fusing them into abominations cursed to fight among themselves for all time. Since the first skull lords were exiled into the shadows, others have arisen, typically created from other leaders who betrayed their masters.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

languages.custom: all the languages it knew in life

description.value: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
The skull lord makes three Bone Staff or Deathly Ray attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 6d6 type=necrotic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 5d8 + @mod type=necrotic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The skull lord casts one of the following spells, using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18):

At will: mage hand, message

2/day each: dimension door, fear

1/day each: cloudkill, &Reference[cone]{cone} of &Reference[cold]{cold}

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The skull lord can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The skull lord regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Attack. The skull lord makes one Bone Staff or Deathly Ray attack.

Move. The skull lord moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Summon &Reference[undead]{Undead} (Costs 2 Actions). The skull lord summons up to five skeleton;skeletons or zombie;zombies (both appear in the Monster Manual) in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. They remain until destroyed. &Reference[undead]{Undead} summoned in this way roll initiative, act in the next available turn, and obey the skull lord. The skull lord can have no more than five &Reference[undead]{Undead} summoned by this ability at a time.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Evasion. If the skull lord is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw to take only half the damage, the skull lord instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn’t &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the skull lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Master of the Grave. While within 30 feet of the skull lord, any &Reference[undead]{Undead} ally of the skull lord makes saving throws with advantage, and that ally regains [[/damage + 6 type=heal average=true]] hit points whenever it starts its turn there.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Unusual &Reference[nat]{Nature}. The skull lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
You point your finger toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence, 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood blocks the spell. The spell doesn't have to follow a straight &Reference[line]{line} and can travel freely around corners or through openings.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

materials.value: a short piece of copper wire

description.value:
You teleport yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "upward to the northwest at a 45- degree angle, 300 feet."

You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you cast this spell.

If you would arrive in a place already occupied by an object or a creature, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 &Reference[force]{force} damage, and the spell fails to teleport you.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
You project a phantasmal image of a creature’s worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot &Reference[cone]{cone} must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for the duration.

While &Reference[frightened]{frightened} by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn’t have &Reference[line]{line} of sight to you, the creature can make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

materials.value: a white feather or the heart of a hen

description.value:
You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of poisonous, yellow-green fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. Its area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. The creature takes 5d8 &Reference[poison]{poison} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

description.value:
A blast of &Reference[cold]{cold} air erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 60-foot &Reference[cone]{cone} must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. A creature takes 8d8 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

source.book: Player’s Handbook

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone
